title.value: Generic Respiratory Disease Case Investigation Form

description.value: Generic Respiratory Disease Case Investigation Form

text.value: Generic Respiratory Disease Case Investigation Form
B. Interview respondent Information (if not patient)
Date of first health facility visit (including traditional care)
Total health facilities visited till outcome
Date of intensive care unit admission
E. Patient symptoms (from disease onset) and complications
Patient was vaccinated for influenza in the past 12 months
Veterinary worker (if yes, specify animal types handled in the 10 days before illness)
Wildlife worker (if yes, specify animal types handled in the 10 days before illness)
Live animal market worker (if yes, specify animal types handled in the 10 days before illness)
Farm worker (if yes, specify animal types handled in the 10 days before illness)
H. Patient human exposures in the 14 days before illness onset
Patient visited outpatient treatment facility (if yes, specify)
Patient visited traditional healer (if yes, specify)
Patient visited or was admitted to inpatient health facility (if yes, specify)
Patient attended festival or mass gathering (if yes, specify)
Patient exposed to person with similar illness
Unique case ID of sick person (if available)
Relationship to current patient (specify, e.g. family, friend, health-care worker, colleague)
Sick person confirmed or deemed a probable case in current event
I. Patient travel history in the 14 days before illness onset (add sheets if multiple locations visited)
Patient travelled out of first administrative region
Patient travelled with companions (if yes, specify)
J. Patient animal exposures in the 14 days before illness onset
Types of animals handled (e.g. pigs, chicken, ducks or others)
Nature of contact (e.g. feed, groom or slaughter)
Within 2 weeks before or after contact, any animals sick or dead? (if yes, specify type and number, and proportion from flock or herd)
Patient exposed to animals in environment but did not handle them (e.g. in neighbourhood, farm, zoo, at home, agricultural fair or work)
Types of animals in that environment (e.g. pigs, chicken, ducks or others)
Within 2 weeks before or after exposure to animals in the environment, any animals sick or dead? (if yes, specify type and number, and proportion from flock or herd)
Patient exposed to animal by-products (e.g. bird feathers) or animal excreta (if yes, specify product)
Patient visited live animal market (if yes, specify market)
K. Patient food exposures in the 14 days before illness onset
Patient consumed raw or unpasteurized animal products (if yes, specify products)
Patient consumed health or traditional remedies with raw or unpasteurized animal products (if yes, specify products)
From the point of view of the patient or family, what is the likely source of infection and geographic location of exposure?
Specimens collected from patient (tick as needed)
Specimens shipped to international reference laboratories
Specify titres (e.g. paired serum for influenza)
